items.content_html: First attempt at a lip wrap (on the orange cup) went poorly, but I really like the pink glass I’ve been working with.
items.content_text: First attempt at a lip wrap (on the orange cup) went poorly, but I really like the pink glass I’ve been working with.

items.content_html:
I got my first hot shop blown foot into the box and safely annealed yesterday. It’s ugly as fuck but it’s on center, well attached, and stands straight 😅

Next week let’s see if I manage that with a stem too 😂
items.content_text: I got my first hot shop blown foot into the box and safely annealed yesterday. It’s ugly as fuck but it’s on center, well attached, and stands straight 😅 Next week let’s see if I manage that with a stem too 😂

items.content_html: New tools unpacked and tagged, excited to go make things with them 💖
items.content_text: New tools unpacked and tagged, excited to go make things with them 💖

items.content_html:
I really do like finding the quiet spaces even in the busiest places.

I can’t say I particularly enjoy Venice, but the color and vibrancy are at least a nice break from the monotony of Berlin.
items.content_text: I really do like finding the quiet spaces even in the busiest places. I can’t say I particularly enjoy Venice, but the color and vibrancy are at least a nice break from the monotony of Berlin.

items.content_html: I love picking things up from the flameworking studio 😅

items.content_html: “Don’t talk to me or my son ever again”

items.content_html:
How it started vs how it’s going, glassblowing edition.

One of the first cups I made a few months ago vs the last (and first twisty) cup I made in December.

Excited to keep learning 😅
items.content_text: How it started vs how it's going, glassblowing edition. One of the first cups I made a few months ago vs the last (and first twisty) cup I made in December. Excited to keep learning 😅

items.content_html: Like all things glass, I kinda liked where this was going - so naturally it cracked as I was getting ready to anneal it 😂😭
items.content_text: Like all things glass, I kinda liked where this was going - so naturally it cracked as I was getting ready to anneal it 😂😭

items.content_html: It’s my birthday tomorrow and I got myself the stupidest present and I love it (Leica iiia from 1937, I’m its second owner in that time)
items.content_text: It’s my birthday tomorrow and I got myself the stupidest present and I love it (Leica iiia from 1937, I’m its second owner in that time)

items.content_html: Started working on a flameworking piece today. First up is a bunch of leaves, going autumnal 🍂
items.content_text: Started working on a flameworking piece today. First up is a bunch of leaves, going autumnal 🍂

items.content_html: It lost its body ridges bc I got it too hot, but hey… ugly pumpkin!
items.content_text: It lost its body ridges bc I got it too hot, but hey… ugly pumpkin!

items.content_html:
All of my forms of artistic expression require weird equipment and a location outside of an apartment 🥲

It kinda sucks and I’m so seriously tempted to move out of the city a bit to have a garage to build a small flameworking studio in 😭

items.content_html: I learnt to make glass pumpkins today! 🎃
items.content_text: I learnt to make glass pumpkins today! 🎃

items.content_html: I’m spending today migrating some things from plain old HTTP+JSON to grpc/connect-rpc and I forgot how much I kinda love grpc tooling when working with Go (and you keep a “good enough” JSON API with connect too)
items.content_text: I’m spending today migrating some things from plain old HTTP+JSON to grpc/connect-rpc and I forgot how much I kinda love grpc tooling when working with Go (and you keep a “good enough” JSON API with connect too)

items.content_html:
My home dev+scan setup for color film seems to work 😅

I’ve been avoiding shooting film this year after being unhappy with my “default” lab, so it’s nice that I can have the control that I want now.

This isn’t a good photo, but hey! I pulled it out of the film soup! And it isn’t weird! 📷🎉
items.content_text: My home dev+scan setup for color film seems to work 😅 I’ve been avoiding shooting film this year after being unhappy with my “default” lab, so it’s nice that I can have the control that I want now. This isn’t a good photo, but hey! I pulled it out of the film soup! And it isn’t weird! 📷🎉

items.content_html: Self developing color film for the first time is highlighting a very annoying fact: Removing dust from color images is so much more work than from black and white (where it’s easy in post). Spending a lot of time with a cloth and isopropanol right now 😭
items.content_text: Self developing color film for the first time is highlighting a very annoying fact: Removing dust from color images is so much more work than from black and white (where it's easy in post). Spending a lot of time with a cloth and isopropanol right now 😭

items.content_html: Upgraded my home development setup, I no longer need to do manual inversions or temp compensation 😅
items.content_text:
Upgraded my home development setup, I no longer need to do manual inversions or temp compensation 😅

items.content_html: Really gonna miss the PNW when I leave tomorrow - Brandenburg nominally has a bunch of forest areas, but the flatness and lack of natural features mean they get old pretty quick.
items.content_text: Really gonna miss the PNW when I leave tomorrow - Brandenburg nominally has a bunch of forest areas, but the flatness and lack of natural features mean they get old pretty quick.

items.content_html: You can’t always pick your conditions when doing landscape photography, and this was a difficult scene to pull contrast between mountain tops and the sky from, but I like the way it kinda works in b/w. 📸
items.content_text: You can't always pick your conditions when doing landscape photography, and this was a difficult scene to pull contrast between mountain tops and the sky from, but I like the way it kinda works in b/w. 📸

items.content_html: Yesterday a friend took me to Mt Rainier for the first time and I think I have a new favourite place on earth. I still need to give this photo a bit more of a Lr pass, but it’s one I’m excited about because it involved going over the water on a fallen tree “bridge” 😅 📸
items.content_text: Yesterday a friend took me to Mt Rainier for the first time and I think I have a new favourite place on earth. I still need to give this photo a bit more of a Lr pass, but it's one I'm excited about because it involved going over the water on a fallen tree "bridge" 😅 📸

items.content_html: Yesterday I got to watch some glassblowing up close and it was incredible (and I’ve now booked an introductory class 🙈) 📸
items.content_text: Yesterday I got to watch some glassblowing up close and it was incredible (and I’ve now booked an introductory class 🙈) 📸

items.content_html: We didn’t get to see the aurora at its peak on Friday bc of the clouds (and I was too sick to go far enough to escape them), but we got to briefly see the aurora on Saturday <3 📸
items.content_text: We didn't get to see the aurora at its peak on Friday bc of the clouds (and I was too sick to go far enough to escape them), but we got to briefly see the aurora on Saturday <3 📸

items.content_html: Spring is finally here 💖📷
items.content_text: Spring is finally here 💖📷

items.content_html: 📷 Moody Friend.
items.content_text: 📷 Moody Friend.

items.content_html: The term “Content Creator” really needs to die before AI finishes killing the arts - people devaluing themselves and their work by reducing it to “content” to be mindlessly consumed is what lets arbitrarily generated mediocrity win 😭
items.content_text: The term "Content Creator" really needs to die before AI finishes killing the arts - people devaluing themselves and their work by reducing it to "content" to be mindlessly consumed is what lets arbitrarily generated mediocrity win 😭

items.content_html: I do love to make unexpected friends on winter walks ❄️🐿️📷
items.content_text: I do love to make unexpected friends on winter walks ❄️🐿️📷

items.content_html:
I’ve been posting too many sunset photos (I’m not that sorry) - but I’m really tempted to make some wallpapers out of this.

Mainland Spain, Gibraltar, and Ceuta in a single shot on a clear day is pretty beautiful tbqh.

Marbella, December 2023.
items.content_text: I've been posting too many sunset photos (I'm not that sorry) - but I'm really tempted to make some wallpapers out of this. Mainland Spain, Gibraltar, and Ceuta in a single shot on a clear day is pretty beautiful tbqh. Marbella, December 2023.

A Christmas Orange

Marbella, December 2023 - Kodak Gold 200.

items.content_html: more film from Andalusia - sunsets and mountains (also I think my first roll of Kodak Gold in 120).
items.content_text: more film from Andalusia - sunsets and mountains (also I think my first roll of Kodak Gold in 120).

items.content_html:
I got film back from my fav lab today… and apparently I need to do some light seal replacements (truly the joy of shooting film)

I quite like this photo though - from a rest stop as we were leaving Marbella to drive to Seville, a lovely view over the town of Ojén.
items.content_text: I got film back from my fav lab today... and apparently I need to do some light seal replacements (truly the joy of shooting film) I quite like this photo though - from a rest stop as we were leaving Marbella to drive to Seville, a lovely view over the town of Ojén.

items.content_html:
monkeying around. 🐒📸.

Gibraltar, Dec 2023.
items.content_text: monkeying around. 🐒📸. Gibraltar, Dec 2023.

items.content_html: I can’t stop thinking about the amount of intricate detail that fills the Nasrid palaces. Especially in comparison to the later parts that were built by the Spanish that are plain plaster and terracotta.
items.content_text: I can't stop thinking about the amount of intricate detail that _fills_ the Nasrid palaces. Especially in comparison to the later parts that were built by the Spanish that are plain plaster and terracotta.

items.content_html: The sheer detail and craftsmanship that went into this place is… incredible. I’m… lost for words.
items.content_text: The sheer detail and craftsmanship that went into this place is… incredible. I’m… lost for words.

items.content_html: Today we’re visiting Alhambra and I am very excited
items.content_text: Today we’re visiting Alhambra and I am very excited

items.content_html: Getting lost in sunsets by the sea 🌅📷
items.content_text: Getting lost in sunsets by the sea 🌅📷

items.content_html: Today we’re exploring Alcázar. Exploring places with such a varied history is alway fascinating, but heartbreaking when you consider what was lost and destroyed.
items.content_text: Today we’re exploring Alcázar. Exploring places with such a varied history is alway fascinating, but heartbreaking when you consider what was lost and destroyed.

items.content_html: 📷. I’m enjoying a lot of the monkey photos from today - this one was very wistful for a while (before harassing some other tourists who presumably were foolish enough to pack food).
items.content_text: 📷. I'm enjoying a lot of the monkey photos from today - this one was very wistful for a while (before harassing some other tourists who presumably were foolish enough to pack food).

items.content_html: Day 2: Exploring Gibraltar - we met many good monkeys. 📷.
items.content_text: Day 2: Exploring Gibraltar - we met many good monkeys. 📷.

items.content_html:
Sierra Blanca, Marbella.

This trip is off to a lovely start, with a lot of light and peace. 📸.
items.content_text: Sierra Blanca, Marbella. This trip is off to a lovely start, with a lot of light and peace. 📸.

items.content_html:
Spending the rest of the year taking a break from computers 💻 and doing a photography road trip around Andalusia ☀️📷🌴

I’d love recommendations for Gibraltar/Granada/Seville/Córdoba if anyone has them!
items.content_text: Spending the rest of the year taking a break from computers 💻 and doing a photography road trip around Andalusia ☀️📷🌴 I’d love recommendations for Gibraltar/Granada/Seville/Córdoba if anyone has them!

items.content_html:
Berlin does have a haunting charm. 📸.

I think switching a lot of my photography to black and white / spending more time roaming around the east is making me find bits of this city that I like, even in the Winter.
items.content_text: Berlin does have a haunting charm. 📸. I think switching a lot of my photography to black and white / spending more time roaming around the east is making me find bits of this city that I like, even in the Winter.

items.content_html: 📸. Photography in the winter is hard, but there’s a definite allure to winter skies ☁️.
items.content_text: 📸. Photography in the winter is hard, but there's a definite allure to winter skies ☁️.

items.content_html:
I made it outside with my 500C/M today - despite recovering from a flu+covid double vax 💉💉.

I forgot how good shooting film is for my brain. Time for some moody b/w to go alongside Berlin’s overcast season 😅

items.content_html: I think I would like to switch back to a split #keyboard for the majority of my work typing but I can’t decide if I should just buy a moonlander (easy, decent software guaranteed) or if i should investigate the current state of funky hipster split diy designs 😅
items.content_text: I think I would like to switch back to a split #keyboard for the majority of my work typing but I can't decide if I should just buy a moonlander (easy, decent software guaranteed) or if i should investigate the current state of funky hipster split diy designs 😅

items.content_html:
We re-watched Legally Blonde last night and honestly I’m still amazed by how well that movie aged.

Even with some of the plot points that many others failed to do well, not a single scene needs “ah but it was of its time!!!” excuses for bigotry - and 22 years later still manages to be… comforting?
items.content_text:
We re-watched Legally Blonde last night and honestly I'm still amazed by how well that movie aged.

Even with some of the plot points that many others failed to do well, not a single scene needs "ah but it was of its time!!!" excuses for bigotry - and 22 years later still manages to be... comforting?

items.content_html: I love visiting zoos when traveling - today is London Zoo, where the Lemurs were being incredibly friendly 😅
items.content_text: I love visiting zoos when traveling - today is London Zoo, where the Lemurs were being incredibly friendly 😅

items.content_html: I find it hard to photograph Berlin, so finding quiet spaces is always appreciated.
items.content_text: I find it hard to photograph Berlin, so finding quiet spaces is always appreciated.

items.content_html:
#NichtMitUns In times like these it feels like a moral imperative to protest against those who take their marginal plurality and use it to fuel their attempts at a culture war.

The CDU and their SPD collaborators want to scrap bike lanes and build a highway through the city - we say no.
items.content_text: #NichtMitUns In times like these it feels like a moral imperative to protest against those who take their marginal plurality and use it to fuel their attempts at a culture war. The CDU and their SPD collaborators want to scrap bike lanes and build a highway through the city - we say no.

items.title: Sometimes a hike isn't what you'd expect.
items.content_html: This recent trip to Brocken/Harz National Park was definitely one of those where the joy was drained out of you. They kill many of the lower trees and just… leave them to rot… to “protect” nearby commercial forests from bugs - and this is the result 😔.
items.content_text: This recent trip to Brocken/Harz National Park was definitely one of those where the joy was drained out of you. They kill many of the lower trees and just... leave them to rot... to "protect" nearby commercial forests from bugs - and this is the result 😔.
